intro: Brodiaea paysonii, commonly known as the Payson brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and striking clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It is known for its short growing season and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. Brodiaea paysonii is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
